FuncDef:
The flow-interface-group command creates a BGP Flow Specification interface group and displays the interface group view or directly displays the view of an existing BGP Flow Specification interface group.
The undo flow-interface-group command deletes a BGP Flow Specification interface group.
By default, no BGP Flow Specification interface group is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a BGP Flow Specification interface group ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 16383.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Without a BGP Flow Specification interface group, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes take effect globally, not on a specified interface. If a BGP Flow Specification interface group is configured, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes also take effect on a specified interface. In this manner, traffic can be forwarded based on the rules of the BGP Flow Specification routes on the specified interface.
Follow-up Procedure
After a BGP Flow Specification interface group is created and its view is displayed using the flow-interface-group command in the system view, the following operations need to be performed so that the traffic filtering rules configured for a BGP Flow Specification route take effect on a specified interface:
Run the interface command in the BGP Flow Specification interface group view to add an interface to the group.Run the flow-interface-group command in the Flow-Route view to associate the BGP Flow Specification interface group with a BGP Flow Specification route.
The preceding operations are required between forwarders, not between the controller and forwarders.

Precautions
The traffic filtering rules of a BGP Flow Specification route that are configured on an interface take precedence over those configured globally. If no traffic filtering rules are configured on an interface for a BGP Flow Specification route, the global configuration takes effect.
